issues.description: The problem statement and UML require SealSaloon.calculateTotalPrice(Meal) to return a double (it explicitly says 'double precision' and UML shows : double). In the solution repository the method is implemented as public static int calculateTotalPrice(Meal) and returns an int. This is a structural return-type mismatch: students following the spec will implement/expect a double-returning method, while the reference solution uses an int. This mismatch can confuse students about the required signature and numeric precision and may cause grading/test mismatches.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the calculateTotalPrice method's return type consistent with the problem statement: change its signature to return double (public static double calculateTotalPrice(Meal meal)) and compute/return a double sum (e.g., double sum = 0.0; add ingredient prices as doubles). Update any corresponding references/tests to expect a double. This preserves the intended double-precision financial calculation and aligns solution and specification.
